attributes.action: Prohibit eviction from any type of accommodation after coronavirus outbreak
attributes.additional_details:
Evictions destroys mental health, private and professional lives, traumatise and put the tenants into severe debts. Evictions cause loss of basic security in the tenants, and ruins the continuity of their affairs. More often evictions being carried out by the landlords from very unjustifiable reasons and served within unreasonable short notice.

Illegal evictions become practically non-prosecutable in the UK, although they occur on a mass scale.
attributes.background: A right to housing is a basic human right. Implement permanently a total prohibition of eviction, of any kind, unless ordered by the Court as a result of quick and easily accessible for both, tenants and landlords, legal process

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to protect tenants from eviction during the coronavirus outbreak, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want the Government to make.

Your petition asks for eviction from any type of property to be prohibited, but goes on to suggest there should be an easy to access legal procedure open to tenants and landlords. It is therefore not clear in what circumstances you want it to be possible for tenancies to be ended.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Give protection to renters during Corvid-19 Crisis. Ban evictions for one year: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304682

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
